comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of February 27, 1914, query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30A16FF3D5E13738... indicates that the Chicago Whitesox played a game in London against the New York Giants. King George V attended.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Another Bain/LOC photo of Chicago White Sox players Daly and Faber in their hotel room, after returning, on the Lusitania, from a five-month world tour with the New York Giants:[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4998803026/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
The companion photo bears Bain's date, 3/9/14.

LOC's title on this photo is misleading. The teams had finished their world tour and returned to America three days before the picture was taken.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
The Cunard Line's Lusitania in New York harbor on March 6, 1914, returning the Giants and White Sox to American soil after five months on tour abroad. Bain's title reads "Lusitania with Baseball Men":
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5051564664/in/photostream/]
Another photo is labeled "Ship With Fans":
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5169599074/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo from the New York Giants / Chicago White Sox World Tour, posted on Flickr on March 11, 2011:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5517543916/in/photostream/]
